incidents.name: Audio Quality Issues in Phone Calls to a Subset of Twilio Australia Numbers

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing audio quality issues in phone calls using a subset of Twilio Australia phone numbers. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing a recovery from the audio quality issues in phone calls using a subset of Twilio Australia phone numbers. We are monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery, and we will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing a problem with audio quality in phone calls with a subset of Twilio Australia phone numbers. We are currently working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We've become aware of a potential issue with inbound Calls to a subset of Twilio Australia Numbers. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Delays in Inbound/Outbound Voice Over Interconnect and Elastic SIP Trunking in Ashburn (US1) and Time Outs in MMS

incident_updates.body: The issue has been fully resolved. Inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US-1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and MMS & SMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free are working normally. Customers who moved off US-1 may move their traffic back to US-1 at any time.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. Customers connecting via Twilio Interconnect to our US East Coast (Virginia) edge location can avoid the problem by routing their traffic to either our US West Coast (San Jose) edge location (which they would have had to purchase) or any of our public Internet edges. This impacts SIP Interfaces, Client Web and Elastic SIP Trunking. We will provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. Customers connecting via Twilio Interconnect to our US East Coast (Virginia) edge location can avoid the problem by routing their traffic to either our US West Coast (San Jose) edge location (which they would have had to purchase) or any of our public Internet edges. This impacts SIP Interfaces, Client Web and Elastic SIP Trunking. We will provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. Customers connecting via Twilio Interconnect to our US East Coast (Virginia) edge location can avoid the problem by routing their traffic to either our US West Coast (San Jose) edge location (which they would have had to purchase) or any of our public Internet edges. This impacts SIP Interfaces, Client Web and Elastic SIP Trunking. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. PSTN delays have been mitigated. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location Interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP) and Elastic SIP Trunking may experience timeouts and one-way audio which includes PSTN calls getting delayed with one-way audio. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location Interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP) and Elastic SIP Trunking may experience timeouts and one-way audio which includes PSTN calls getting delayed with one-way audio. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location Interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP) and Elastic SIP trunking may experience timeouts and one-way audio which includes PSTN calls getting delayed with one-way audio. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Voice product. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 10% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: Connectivity losses in Super SIM Devices have been restored and Super SIM Devices are operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the Super SIM connectivity issues. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

While attempting to restore all Twilio services to normal, we made a configuration change at our datacenter modifying how some traffic between Twilio's Mobile Core and our carrier partners is handled at 2:16 PM PT. This may have created some delays or prevented devices from connecting in a small number of countries. The most notable impact observed by Twilio was in New Zealand. At ~8:00 PM PT, the issue was identified and we temporarily blocked attachments on the impacted connectivity partner in New Zealand. SIMs failing to connect should have failed over to backup IMSIs on the SIMs allowing them to reconnect via an alternative connectivity partner. At ~9:00 PM PT, the configuration change was reverted and we re-enabled the blocked connectivity partner in New Zealand. Impact in other countries not identified by Twilio should have subsided after the configuration change was reverted. We'll provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The transfer of traffic between nodes within our datacenter has completed. During the process, we observed 7% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the new node. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely.  We'll provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The transfer of traffic between nodes within our datacenter has completed. During the process, we observed 7% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the new node. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely.  We'll provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Twilio engineering is planning to move traffic between nodes within our datacenter as part of the ongoing emergency maintenance at 12:15 PM PT. Super SIM data connectivity is expected to be impacted to a similar degree as the 8:15am PT drop when a similar event occurred. We'll provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Twilio engineering is continuing to work with our datacenter partners to restore all Twilio services. We are monitoring for any changes in traffic patterns in our datacenter that may result in a temporary drop in data session connectivity. We'll provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During the emergency maintenance we observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped as they might have lost data connectivity at 8:15 AM PT. The drop was caused by moving traffic back to primary datacenter hardware to which the latest update has been applied. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the new node. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During the emergency maintenance we observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped as they might have lost data connectivity at 8:15 AM PT. The drop was caused by moving traffic back to primary datacenter hardware to which the latest update has been applied. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the new node. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During the emergency maintenance we observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped as they might have lost data connectivity. The drop was due to a failover operation required to re-establish connectivity in one of our data centers. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During the emergency maintenance we observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped as they might have lost data connectivity. The drop was due to a failover operation required to re-establish connectivity in one of our data centers. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified the cause of the Super SIM connectivity issues. Our team has determined that the problem stems from a network node malfunction. To address this issue, the emergency maintenance is in progress. During this maintenance, there may be temporary connectivity loss for some devices. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified the cause of the Super SIM connectivity issues. Our team has determined that the problem stems from a network node malfunction. To address this issue, we will be conducting an emergency maintenance within the next hour, beginning at 2 am PT. During this maintenance, there may be temporary connectivity loss for some devices. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped at 1:15 PT. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 10% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: Connectivity lost on Super SIM devices has been resolved and Super SIM PDN Session is operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped at 23:13 PT. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM Connectivity. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incident_updates.body: Active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped has been resolved and Super SIM is operating normally at this time.

Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM Connectivity. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Errors for the Twilio Rest API Impacting Multiple Twilio Services

incident_updates.body: The issue impacting multiple products has been resolved, and Twilio services are operating normally at this time.
All affected services are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We’ll provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineering team continues to observe indications of recovery on our TaskRouter and Flex services, but with continued intermittent issues, which are being identified and addressed.

In parallel, our teams are continuing to work on the remediation of the following services: Voice Insights, Verify, Sync, Debugger & Alerts, Rest API, Twilio Notify,  IoT - Programmable Wireless, and Serverless Functions logs services. In clarification to a prior update, there was no impact to Event Stream services.

Our engineering teams will continue to work towards full restoration of all affected services and will provide an update in 1 hour or sooner if we have further information.

Please note that automated SMS routing and SMS conversion rates are not impacted at this time.

Our engineering teams are continuing to implement the redeployment of the underlying service, but the initial estimated time to partial mitigation is being extended until 9:30 am PST. No additional information is available at this time. We will continue to provide updates every 30 minutes or sooner if we have further pertinent information.

Our engineering teams continue to work on the redeployment of the underlying service. No additional information is available at this time. We will continue to provide updates every 30 minutes or sooner if we have further pertinent information.

Our engineering teams are continuing to work on the redeployment of the underlying service. No additional information is available at this time. We will continue to provide updates every 30 minutes or sooner if we have further pertinent information.

Our engineering team has identified that a degraded underlying service is causing failures on upstream services affecting multiple products. We are redeploying the underlying service across all other services. Our initial estimate was that partial mitigation would start at 8:00am PST, but our engineers have now updated that to start at 9:00am PST.  As we redeploy the service, this estimate may change. We will continue to provide updates every 30 minutes or sooner if we have further information.

We have declared a sev0 incident related to ongoing issues affecting multiple products, including Flex, Programmable Voice, ElasticSearch, Insights, Voice insights, Programmable SMS, Automated SMS routing, Task Router Statistics, Agent Login, and support live chat. All necessary teams have been engaged to remediate the issue and restore services as soon as possible. We will provide an update in 1 hour or as soon as we have further information.

We have declared a sev0 incident related to ongoing issues affecting multiple products, including Flex, Programmable Voice, ElasticSearch, Insights, Voice insights, Programmable SMS, Automated SMS routing, Task Router Statistics, and Agent Login. All necessary teams have been engaged to remediate the issue and restore services as soon as possible. We will. provide an update in 30 minutes or as soon as we have further information.

We are experiencing issues with the Twilio Rest API, impacting multiple Twilio services. Customer are experiencing voice insights call events for client/SDK being delayed, and errors retrieving 408 errors. Customers may also experiencing issues with Flex edge services, SMS conversion rate and Verify. We’re consolidating the following StatusPage posts: https://status.twilio.com/incidents/pzhb9l80kkg7, https://status.twilio.com/incidents/vy2l3p2pp7xm, https://status.twilio.com/incidents/6qbh9vr54f8p, https://status.twilio.com/incidents/xtn4n1vwyrjf. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issues. We expect to provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating errors for the Twilio Rest API, impacting multiple Twilio services. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

components.name: Verify
components.description: May be impacted by SMS delivery issues

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to AT&T Network in the US

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to AT&T Network in the US. This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS Long Code, North America

incident_updates.body: We are observing an improvement on SMS delivery delays when sending messages to AT&T Network in the US. Our engineers are monitoring the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information is available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS Long Code, North America

incident_updates.body: We are experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to AT&T Network in the US. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to CTBC Celular Network in Brazil

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to CTBC Celular network in Brazil. This incident is now solved.

We are observing an improvement on SMS delivery delays when sending messages to CTBC Celular network in Brazil. Our engineers are monitoring the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information is available.

We are still experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to CTBC Celular network in Brazil. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to all Brazil networks over a subset of shortcodes. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Voice Insights Call Events for Client/SDK Calls are Delayed

incident_updates.body: We are still experiencing an issue with Voice Insights Call Events for Client/SDK Calls being Delayed, however, we have consolidated all impacting products in to one incident. You can check the status of this here: https://status.twilio.com/incidents/zvn36fs3npth

The engineering team are still investigating an issue with Voice Insights Call Events for Client/SDK Calls being Delayed. We are seeing issues with Video Insights data. Video Insights API and Console requests to get the data for rooms created after 3.00 AM PST might result in 404s. Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with ES Rejection in Voice Insights Client Cluster lead to Kafka Delay in Voice Insights Applications. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
